title: Jeremiah Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Jeremiah with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 52 chapters.

questions.question: Who was Jeremiah's father?
questions.explanation: Jeremiah was the son of Hilkiah, a priest.

questions.question: In which town was Jeremiah from?
questions.explanation: Jeremiah was from Anathoth in the land of Benjamin.

questions.question: What did the LORD say to Jeremiah before he was formed in the belly?
options: I knew thee and sanctified thee
questions.correctAnswer: I knew thee and sanctified thee
questions.explanation: God told Jeremiah he knew him before birth and sanctified him.

questions.question: What did Jeremiah say in response to God's call?
options: I cannot speak, I am a child
questions.correctAnswer: I cannot speak, I am a child
questions.explanation: Jeremiah expressed fear because he was young and unable to speak well.

questions.question: How did God encourage Jeremiah regarding his fear of speaking?
options: Say not 'I am a child', for I will be with you
questions.correctAnswer: Say not 'I am a child', for I will be with you
questions.explanation: God told Jeremiah not to fear because He would be with him to deliver him.

questions.question: What object did Jeremiah see that represented God’s hastening of His word?
questions.explanation: The almond tree symbolizes hastening; God said He would hasten His word.

questions.question: From which direction would the evil break forth upon all the inhabitants of the land?
questions.explanation: God announced that an evil would come from the north upon the land.

questions.question: What was Jeremiah appointed over by God?
questions.explanation: God set Jeremiah over the nations and kingdoms to root out and destroy.

questions.question: What did the LORD tell Jeremiah to do with the linen girdle?
options: Put it on his loins and hide it by Euphrates
questions.correctAnswer: Put it on his loins and hide it by Euphrates
questions.explanation: Jeremiah was told to wear the girdle and then hide it in a rock near Euphrates.

questions.question: What happened to the girdle after Jeremiah retrieved it from hiding?
options: It was marred and good for nothing
questions.correctAnswer: It was marred and good for nothing
questions.explanation: The girdle was ruined, symbolizing the pride of Judah being marred.

questions.question: What metaphor did God use to describe His relationship with Israel and Judah in Jeremiah 13:11?
options: As a girdle cleaving to the loins
As a lion guarding its prey
As a shepherd with his sheep
questions.correctAnswer: As a girdle cleaving to the loins
questions.explanation: God said He caused Israel and Judah to cleave to Him as a girdle to a man's loins.

questions.question: According to Jeremiah 25, how long would the nations serve the king of Babylon?
questions.explanation: The nations would serve Babylon for seventy years as prophesied.

questions.question: What did God command Jeremiah to do with the wine cup of fury?
questions.explanation: Jeremiah was told to cause all nations to drink the cup of God's fury.

questions.question: What was the consequence for those who refused to drink the cup of God's fury?
questions.explanation: God declared that those who refuse would still drink the cup.

questions.question: Which king of Babylon was specifically mentioned as God's servant?
questions.explanation: Nebuchadrezzar was called God's servant to bring judgment.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah was instructed to be afraid of the faces of the people he spoke to.
questions.explanation: God told Jeremiah not to be afraid because He would be with him to deliver him.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah was a priest by lineage.
questions.explanation: Jeremiah was the son of Hilkiah, who was a priest.

questions.question: True or False: The pride of Judah and Jerusalem was compared to a girdle that remained useful.
questions.explanation: The pride was compared to a girdle that became marred and good for nothing.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah's prophecies included warnings against serving other gods.
questions.explanation: Jeremiah repeatedly warned against idolatry and serving other gods.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah's message was only for the people of Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: Jeremiah was set over nations and kingdoms, and his message was for all the people of Judah and beyond.

questions.question: True or False: God promised that the people would repent and the destruction would be averted.
questions.explanation: Despite calls to repentance, the people did not listen, and destruction was prophesied.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah was told to prophesy that the LORD would roar from on high against all inhabitants of the earth.
questions.explanation: Jeremiah was told to announce God's mighty roar against all inhabitants.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Before I formed thee in the belly I _____ thee; and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee.'
questions.explanation: God said He knew Jeremiah before forming him in the belly.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Can the Ethiopian change his _____, or the leopard his spots? then may ye also do good, that are accustomed to do evil.'
questions.explanation: The verse uses the metaphor of changing skin to describe the difficulty of changing behavior.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For thus saith the LORD God of Israel unto me; Take the wine cup of this _____ at my hand, and cause all the nations, to whom I send thee, to drink it.'
questions.explanation: God commanded Jeremiah to make nations drink the cup of His fury.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Be not afraid of their faces: for I am with thee to _____ thee, saith the LORD.'
questions.explanation: God assured Jeremiah He would deliver him from his enemies.

questions.question: What was Jeremiah told to do when he saw the seething pot facing north?
options: Prophesy that evil would break forth from the north
questions.correctAnswer: Prophesy that evil would break forth from the north
questions.explanation: The seething pot facing north symbolized coming evil from that direction.

questions.question: Who was ruling Judah in the thirteenth year when Jeremiah received the word of the LORD?
questions.explanation: Jeremiah's call came in the thirteenth year of Josiah's reign.

questions.question: According to Jeremiah 25, what sounds would be taken away from the land due to judgment?
options: Voice of mirth, gladness, bridegroom, and bride
questions.correctAnswer: Voice of mirth, gladness, bridegroom, and bride
questions.explanation: God spoke of removing joyful sounds as a sign of desolation.

questions.question: Which kings and peoples are specifically mentioned as drinking the wine cup of God's fury? (Select one)
options: Kings of Egypt, Philistines, Edom, Moab, Ammon
Kings of Assyria and Babylon only
questions.correctAnswer: Kings of Egypt, Philistines, Edom, Moab, Ammon
questions.explanation: Jeremiah lists many nations including Egypt and its neighbors among those punished.

questions.question: What does Jeremiah compare the people of Judah to, because they refuse to hear God's words?
questions.explanation: Their refusal is likened to a ruined girdle.

questions.question: What did God say He would do after seventy years are accomplished?
options: Punish the king of Babylon and his nation
questions.correctAnswer: Punish the king of Babylon and his nation
questions.explanation: God promised to punish Babylon after the seventy years.

questions.question: What was the result of Jeremiah's words to the people of Judah according to Jeremiah 25:3-4?
options: They did not hearken nor incline their ear
questions.correctAnswer: They did not hearken nor incline their ear
questions.explanation: Despite Jeremiah's warnings, the people did not listen.

questions.question: According to Jeremiah 13, what will happen to those who refuse to hear God's words?
options: They shall be as the ruined girdle, good for nothing
They shall prosper and be blessed
They shall be hidden from destruction
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be as the ruined girdle, good for nothing
questions.explanation: Refusal to hear God's words results in ruin like the girdle.

questions.question: Who does Jeremiah say will weep in secret places for the pride of the people if they do not hear?
questions.explanation: Jeremiah's soul will weep in secret if they do not hear God's word.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah was told to humble the king and queen because their principalities would come down.
questions.explanation: Jeremiah told them to humble themselves as their glory would fall.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah’s prophecy included the shutting up of the cities of the south with none to open them.
questions.explanation: Jeremiah prophesied that southern cities would be shut up and captives taken.

questions.question: What did Jeremiah say would happen to the fathers and sons according to Jeremiah 13:14?
options: They would dash one against another
They would serve in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: They would dash one against another
questions.explanation: God declared He would cause familial strife as judgment.

questions.question: What does Jeremiah say about the skirts and heels of the people in Chapter 13?
options: They are uncovered and made bare
questions.correctAnswer: They are uncovered and made bare
questions.explanation: Their iniquity is exposed as skirts and heels are uncovered.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah was told that the LORD would be with him to deliver him from those who fight against him.
questions.explanation: God promised Jeremiah deliverance despite opposition.

questions.question: What did Jeremiah see in his vision that symbolized conflict and judgment against Jerusalem and Judah?
questions.explanation: The seething pot facing north symbolized coming judgment from the north.

questions.question: Which chapter contains the prophecy that the LORD will roar from on high and utter His voice against all the inhabitants of the earth?
questions.explanation: Jeremiah 25 contains this prophecy of the LORD's roar against the earth.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah prophesied that the LORD would punish the land of the Chaldeans after seventy years.
questions.explanation: God said He would punish Babylon after seventy years for their iniquity.

questions.question: In Jeremiah 1, what did God put into Jeremiah’s mouth?
questions.explanation: God put His words into Jeremiah's mouth to speak.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah's prophecies were limited to the kings of Judah only.
questions.explanation: He was set over nations and kingdoms and spoke to all inhabitants.
